meanings.definition: In a quiet or subdued manner.
meanings.sent1: She tiptoed hushedly through the library, careful not to make a sound.
meanings.sent2: The children giggled hushedly during the movie, not wanting to disturb others.
meanings.sent3: The cat crept hushedly towards the unsuspecting mouse, ready to pounce.
meanings.sent4: The fog enveloped the town hushedly, muffling all sounds in its embrace.
meanings.sent5: The old house creaked hushedly in the still of the night, creating an eerie atmosphere.

meanings.definition: Speaking softly or in a whisper.
meanings.sent1: She hushedly whispered the secret to her best friend, making sure no one else could hear.
meanings.sent2: The teacher spoke hushedly to the students during the exam, not wanting to disturb their concentration.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel chattered hushedly to its friend in the tree, sharing the latest news.
meanings.sent4: The wind rustled the leaves hushedly, as if whispering secrets to the trees.
meanings.sent5: The lovers murmured hushedly to each other, lost in their own world of whispers.
